item.title: Installing Syncthing
item.description:
Home

Installation on Mac

I installed Syncthing as a docker container on mac

$ docker pull syncthing/syncthing
$ mkdir ~/code/syncthing
$ cd ~/code/syncthing
$ mkdir build
$ cd build
$ touch Docker-compose.yml

My Docker-compose file looks like below

This is what was I did


version: '2'
services:
  syncthing:
    image: syncthing/syncthing:latest
    ports:
      - "8384:8384"
      - "22000:22000"
    volumes:
      - "./st-cfg:/var/syncthing/config"
      - "./st-sync:/var/syncthing/Sync"
    restart: unless-stopped

My Folder Structure


.
└── build
    ├── docker-compose.yml
    ├── st-cfg
    │   ├── cert.pem
    │   ├── config.xml
    │   ├── csrftokens.txt
    │   ├── https-cert.pem
    │   ├── https-key.pem
    │   ├── index-v0.14.0.db
    │   │   ├── 000002.ldb
    │   │   ├── 000003.log
    │   │   ├── CURRENT
    │   │   ├── LOCK
    │   │   ├── LOG
    │   │   └── MANIFEST-000004
    │   └── key.pem
    └── st-sync

item.title: Dream Infra as a code
item.description:
The Vision

I would love to build an environment that is agnostic enough to be deployed anywhere with zero modifications . An environment that is scalable on demand . Resilient to attacks ,build with highest standards of security. Flexible enough to adapt to change.

Agnostic

What I mean by agnostic ? It means that i can spin a minimal viable stack on a laptop ,a physical infrastructure ,a cloud provider like AWS ,Azure ,Google Cloud Platform.

Scalable

As load increases or decreases it can spin up or down environments on demands , If topology changes are required it is easy to adapt.

Secure

Flexible

Disaster resilient Phoenix Servers

That is we can tear it down, something like a chaos monkey ,and it can rise from the ashes wihout any manual interventions or changes

item.title: Building a Hugo container
item.description:
Home

Installation on Mac

I installed Hugo on mac using brew 

#!
$ brew update
$ brew install hugo

Setup a Hugo Site under 2 mins

I followed the tutorial on the Hugo site


$ cd ~/site
$ hugo new site .
$ hugo new post/welcome.md
$ git clone https://github.com/SenjinDarashiva/hugo-uno.git themes/hugo-uno
$ hugo server -w
$ hugo new post/'Starting with docker'.md
$ hugo new post/'Building a Hugo container'.md

The above created few folder structuer as below


.
├── archetypes
├── config.toml
├── content
│   └── post
├── data
├── layouts
├── static
└── themes
    ├── hugo-theme-docdock
    └── hugo-uno
